intro: Conyza punctulata, commonly known as the punctured weed, is an annual flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza punctulata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
